channel.title: Decided to go back to my old Language
channel.description:
This is the first programming language that I ever learned. It is known as Ruby and RGSS2. Its the new scripting language for RPG Maker VX which you can get here for free: http://up.ht/isq5q9
This is the scripts needed to make an online mmo. If you are still new and dont understand Ruby/RGSS2 then I suggest you go here first: http://www.rpgmakerweb.com/tutorial/rpg-maker-vx
This is not a tutorial just an engine. Intended for intermediate users. You can get a pre-made client and server engine here with no programming knowledge required!: http://up.ht/iLEcsM
Media: [IMG]http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/untitled-3.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/lumby.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/door.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/untitled-2.jpg[/img]
Thanks everyone

item.title: Decided to go back to my old Language
item.dc:creator: @Tu1 Tu
item.description:
@Tu1 wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:30, topic:401768”]Good point, that is the reason why you should use an engine such as Unity 3D, UDK,…
Once you master one of those bigger engines, you will have great opportunity to create something that actully has chances to get huge, both of the above mentioned are free for personal use.

Don’t waste your time in mastering those low end engines, you will always be laughed at in the game developers world and any game you create will be judged.[/quote]

why not just be a boss and write everything yourself?

Read full topic
item.source: Decided to go back to my old Language

item.title: Decided to go back to my old Language
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“GML Programmer, post:34, topic:401768”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=498826.msg3648117#msg3648117 date=1309538493]

[quote author=GML Programmer link=topic=498826.msg3648096#msg3648096 date=1309537614]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=498826.msg3648091#msg3648091 date=1309537302]

[quote author=GML Programmer link=topic=498826.msg3648078#msg3648078 date=1309536609]
That is great advise, and Im not shutting it down, but Im not doing it as a oh im trying to get rich or make some huge hit game, Im just doin this for fun in my spare time. Ruby is a decent language and I can and have made my own games with it Im honestly just to lazy to start from scratch. Why make it harder on myself when there are tons of engines out there to help you?
[/quote]Good point, that is the reason why you should use an engine such as Unity 3D, UDK,…
Once you master one of those bigger engines, you will have great opportunity to create something that actully has chances to get huge, both of the above mentioned are free for personal use.

Don’t waste your time in mastering those low end engines, you will always be laughed at in the game developers world and any game you create will be judged.
[/quote]Ok then I will search between those 2 and see what I come up with.

EDIT: From what I can see they are both pretty great. I would have to go with unity if anything though. I was looking at their scripting language and i have to say Im impressed
[/quote] There are many successful titles developed with Unity, all you need to know is some C# or Javascript.

I was planning to learn Unity as well, like really in-depth but since the new flash player being released soon, and my advanced flash knowlegde, there is no use in learning a new language when the old one has the same power.

Look at this, I made this a year ago, when I started learning basic Unity http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MakuLCb-fyc.
[/quote]Nice. I was reading that in order to distribute or sell games you have to pay unity?[/quote]No, the free version has some limitation available here: http://unity3d.com/unity/licenses.html.
Also, there is a Unity splash screen and in-game logo in the free version.

Read full topic
item.source: Decided to go back to my old Language

item.title: Decided to go back to my old Language
item.dc:creator: @GML_Programmer GML Programmer
item.description:
@GML_Programmer wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:32, topic:401768”][quote author=GML Programmer link=topic=498826.msg3648096#msg3648096 date=1309537614]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=498826.msg3648091#msg3648091 date=1309537302]

[quote author=GML Programmer link=topic=498826.msg3648078#msg3648078 date=1309536609]
That is great advise, and Im not shutting it down, but Im not doing it as a oh im trying to get rich or make some huge hit game, Im just doin this for fun in my spare time. Ruby is a decent language and I can and have made my own games with it Im honestly just to lazy to start from scratch. Why make it harder on myself when there are tons of engines out there to help you?
[/quote]Good point, that is the reason why you should use an engine such as Unity 3D, UDK,…
Once you master one of those bigger engines, you will have great opportunity to create something that actully has chances to get huge, both of the above mentioned are free for personal use.

Don’t waste your time in mastering those low end engines, you will always be laughed at in the game developers world and any game you create will be judged.
[/quote]Ok then I will search between those 2 and see what I come up with.

EDIT: From what I can see they are both pretty great. I would have to go with unity if anything though. I was looking at their scripting language and i have to say Im impressed
[/quote] There are many successful titles developed with Unity, all you need to know is some C# or Javascript.

I was planning to learn Unity as well, like really in-depth but since the new flash player being released soon, and my advanced flash knowlegde, there is no use in learning a new language when the old one has the same power.

Look at this, I made this a year ago, when I started learning basic Unity http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MakuLCb-fyc.[/quote]Nice. I was reading that in order to distribute or sell games you have to pay unity?

Read full topic
item.source: Decided to go back to my old Language

item.title: Decided to go back to my old Language
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“GML Programmer, post:27, topic:401768”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=498826.msg3647957#msg3647957 date=1309528285]
Let me just say this, this is not a language, this is a drag and drop program. The fact that you would post this and expect positive feedback is beyond me.
[/quote]Do some research. Thats all Im gonna say. Without using Ruby and RGSS2 you could not have a great game. The drag and drop is limited and you cant have a very unique game using it. My suggestion, if your not gonna learn the language dont even download this or you will waste your time.[/quote]
I have done all the research I need in the past two years of my life to know that this is not real programming, pick up a damn java book and actually write a game if you ever want to call the shit you put out decent.

Read full topic

That is great advise, and Im not shutting it down, but Im not doing it as a oh im trying to get rich or make some huge hit game, Im just doin this for fun in my spare time. Ruby is a decent language and I can and have made my own games with it Im honestly just to lazy to start from scratch. Why make it harder on myself when there are tons of engines out there to help you?
[/quote]Good point, that is the reason why you should use an engine such as Unity 3D, UDK,…
Once you master one of those bigger engines, you will have great opportunity to create something that actully has chances to get huge, both of the above mentioned are free for personal use.

Don’t waste your time in mastering those low end engines, you will always be laughed at in the game developers world and any game you create will be judged.
[/quote]Ok then I will search between those 2 and see what I come up with.

EDIT: From what I can see they are both pretty great. I would have to go with unity if anything though. I was looking at their scripting language and i have to say Im impressed[/quote] There are many successful titles developed with Unity, all you need to know is some C# or Javascript.

I was planning to learn Unity as well, like really in-depth but since the new flash player being released soon, and my advanced flash knowlegde, there is no use in learning a new language when the old one has the same power.

Look at this, I made this a year ago, when I started learning basic Unity http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MakuLCb-fyc.

Just advice, not hating…

item.title: Decided to go back to my old Language
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Rock N Rolla, post:12, topic:401768”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=498826.msg3647912#msg3647912 date=1309524082]

[quote author=Rock N Rolla link=topic=498826.msg3647905#msg3647905 date=1309523571]

Ive used Ruby before to make my own xbox game
[/quote]I bet you did[size=1pt]n’t.[/size]

I dont care how much you bet LOL
[/quote]XBOX games require high level licenses from Microsoft. They give you their signature, so that you can sign games you write for their console. They first inspect a company, after it passes the inspection, they give the company a unique signing key and a contract that states, when that key gets leaked on the internet, that company has to take responsibility, as I said, it’s a unique key per company.

You are stating that you own a high end game developing company that has passed Mic’s inspecting exam and they gave you the resposibility to the keys that allow you to sign software for the XBOX.

And I am the king of Paris.

Its called a jtag dumbass, it allows you to run unsigned code(aka homebrew) so get your facts right before you go trollin’[/quote]I’m not an XBOX fanboy, nor a PS3 one but I’ve heard that XBOX was the most secure game console and was not yet hacked and other shit like that, but I guess that was wrong information.

Read full topic
item.source: Decided to go back to my old Language

item.title: Decided to go back to my old Language
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“someone2, post:14, topic:401768”]This is unbelievable. RPG maker XP, ruby…

Dude, do you really want to make games on the easy way? You ain’t coming far with this.

I mean, if these game makers would be good, everyone would use them and get rich in no-time.

No, games are made by putting time and effort in it. Well, if you know what those 2 words mean.[/quote]Aren’t his games like, free to play or something? And really, why does it matter so much to you?

Best of luck GML. Make something good

Read full topic
